question: What species’ oldest fossil record dates back to 300,000 years ago?
Why would the global population not have surpassed ten million before the Holocene?
a: Frequent conflicts and wars reduced the global population.
c: The harsh environmental conditions were not hospitable.
d: Humans had not adapted to life outside Western Africa.
e: Fire had not yet been discovered.

question: Which event occurred approximately 20,000 years ago?
Why were Earth’s sea levels noticeably lower in the Pleistocene Epoch?
a: Most water was contained beneath the crust.
b: Most water was locked up in glaciers and ice sheets.
e: Water-bearing comets had not yet crashed into Earth.

question: What are the previous 1,200 years of the Pleistocene Epoch referred to as?
What event occurred 14,000 years ago that caused a negative feedback for over a thousand years?
Which of the following are NOT descriptors of the present?
How do Milankovitch cycles affect the climate?
a: They cause the Earth to shift into a new epoch every 100,000 years.
b: They reduce how much sunlight is reflected back by Earth.
c: They regulate greenhouse gas concentrations in the stratosphere.
d: They slow and speed up the Earth in its elliptical orbit.
e: They affect the solar energy absorbed by Earth.

question: Which of the following is matched correctly?
In terms of climatic patterns, what defines the Quaternary Period?
How many interglacials have there been in the past 800,000 years?
How has humanity’s impact on the environment changed from the Pleistocene to the Holocene Epoch?
b: It has shifted towards more sustainable practices.
c: It has intensified and expanded globally.
d: It has shifted towards more unsustainable practices

question: What factors other than climate might have influenced the transition from the Pleistocene to the Holocene?
What is the relationship between climate and human flourishing during the Holocene?
a: Humans have thrived under very particular environmental conditions.
b: Climate has primarily determined the course of human development during the Holocene.
c: Humans have struggled to adapt to the environmental conditions of the Holocene.
d: Human flourishing during the Holocene has been independent of environmental factors.
e: Climate has played a minor role in human flourishing during the Holocene.
